author: @nanolog522
text: Excel is amazing. In the sense that it is everywhere. I have worked at a researching clinic in Germany where we did neuropsychiatry. I was in the IT and had to deal with the data. Hundreds or thousands of terabytes, high resolution MRI and fMRI videos.  Filepaths were exchanged using Excel sheets. There was a database, but that only saved metadata for the images, because names and so on had to lie on a separate system for privacy reasons. That resulted in a hundreds of gigabytes large Excel sheet with highly sensitive information and days spent resolving bugs stemming from Excel doing Excel things. We had to use that data to work with the data, so we had to import them into Python or Bash, and Excel would add invisible whitespace everywhere.
